channel.title: machine learning on Dinis Peixoto
channel.description: Recent content in machine learning on Dinis Peixoto

item.title: Distributed model inference using Spark
item.description: During the past few days, I have been working on running batch inference for a large amount of data using Spark. The goal was to generate embeddings: text embeddings using a fine-tuned BERT model image embeddings using a fine-tuned ViT model I will use this TIL to share some of the key learnings I could get from this experience. Pandas UDF vs Spark UDF Pandas UDF instead of Spark UDF helps improve performance, also allows running in batches of rows/partition instead of a single row/partition (everything’s explained here).

item.title: Brand Recommendations - TF-IDF
item.description: I have been trying to learn Machine Learning for quite some time now. The main motivation for this was the fact that, at FARFETCH, I work really close to a data science team and wanted to get a grasp of the main challenges that they have to face on a daily basis. It all started with a couple online courses. The thing with these courses is that you get to learn a lot of cool stuff supported with step-by-step tutorials, but I never took some time to actually build something on my own, that tackles a real issue that I’m facing.
